question: A business analyst has been tracking several problems for quite some time on his project. When is the tracking process considered to be complete?

options.A: When the item tracking record is shared with all stakeholders.
options.B: When the assigned owner and the resolver confirm receipt of the problems.
options.D: When each item has been tracked to its closure or resolution.

question: A business analyst is focusing their elicitation activities on transition requirements. Which technique may provide the best requirements for this activity?

The business analyst is evaluating and comparing solution options to one another to recommend one option for the solution. The BA is using weighted criteria to score each option. Which method is the BA employing?
Which of the following is the best definition of business analysis information?

options.A: All information related to business analysis approaches, requirements, and designs.
options.B: Information of any kind, at any level, that is used as an input to, or is an output of, business analysis work.
options.D: All information related to requirements and designs.

question: What are the possible forms that a business analysis (information) package could include?
A requirement must be ________ to ensure that it remains valid over time.
A team is organizing brainstormed items into groups with similarities. Which artifact are they creating?
Which two elicitation techniques are best for confirming stated requirements and stakeholder concerns?
What is the most important reason for a facilitator to use ice-breakers?

options.C: Start building teamwork and positive working relationships.

question: A business analyst is modeling the sequential flow of work with synchronization bars to show parallel processing and multiple exit decision points. Which process model is the business analyst using?

A business analyst conducted a workshop with domain subject matter experts to document an in-scope business process. It appears there may be gaps in the documentation. Which elicitation method will be most effective in discovering and closing the gaps?

options.B: Trust that the documented and confirmed information is correct.
options.D: Schedule another workshop and discuss the potential gaps you discovered.

question: Which of the following techniques would assist in defining approval criteria?
Which of the following techniques may be helpful when identifying business analysis performance improvements?

options.A: Lessons learned, risk analysis and management, workshops, mind mapping.
options.B: Reviews, root cause analysis, survey or questionnaire, document analysis.
options.C: Lessons learned, risk analysis and management, workshops, item tracking.
options.D: Risk analysis and management, reviews, root cause analysis, document analysis.

question: What is the purpose of the specify and model requirements task?

options.A: To analyze, synthesize, and refine elicitation results into requirements and designs.
options.B: To fit the individual models and specifications together to ensure that all of the requirements form a single whole.
options.C: To ensure that all requirements and designs align to the business requirements and support the delivery of needed value.
options.D: To ensure that requirements and designs specifications and models meet quality standards and are usable for the purpose they serve.

question: A business analyst must manage and maintain requirements and design information throughout the requirements life cycle. When does the requirements life cycle begin and end?

options.A: It begins with the business need and ends when the requirements have been implemented.
options.B: It begins with the representation of the business need and ends when the solution is retired.
options.C: It begins with the collection of solution requirements and ends when the solution is retired.
options.D: It begins with project initiation and ends when the project is closed out

question: Requirements traceability identifies and documents the lineage of each requirement. What are the ways in which this lineage can be identified and documented?

options.A: Downwards, upwards, and the relationships between requirements
options.B: Downwards, upwards, and relationships between designs
options.C: Backwards, forwards, and the relationships between requirements
options.D: Backwards, forwards, and the relationships between risks

question: Specifying and modeling requirements is a task in which of the following knowledge areas?
Which type of stakeholder is a help desk agent?
The business analyst is ensuring their requirements are capable of being understood independently of other requirements or designs. Which quality characteristic does this describe?
Data about data can best be described as what?
What is the most important reason for a facilitator to use ice-breakers?

options.B: Start building teamwork and positive working relationships.

question: Which of the following statements best describes job shadowing?

options.A: Involves querying stakeholders and subject matter experts (SMEs), and analyzing their responses.
options.B: Performing personnel's tasks to better understand them.
options.C: Involves bringing stakeholders together in order to collaborate on achieving a predefined goal.
options.D: Involves examining a work activity firsthand as it is performed.

question: The sponsor provided guidance to the business analyst who was inundated with requests to "address the high priority items and get to the rest when you can." What technique could the business analyst leverage to execute the sponsor's guidance?
Which of the following can be said about formal documentation as a possible form for business analysis (information) packages?

options.A: Formal documentation is always presented in the form of a presentation.
options.B: Formal documentation should be approved and signed off on by the sponsor.
options.C: Formal documentation always includes texts, matrices, and/or diagrams.
options.D: Formal documentation is usually based on a template used by the organization and provides a stable, easy to use, long-term record of the information.

question: A business analyst has just completed a requirements workshop. Who should be involved with capturing the elicitation outcomes from the workshop?

options.C: Business analyst, project manager, and scribe

question: Which of the following refer to requirements that have been approved?
The specify and model requirements task can result in a requirement or a design. What is the difference?

options.A: The BA can only specify and model a design.
options.B: When the focus is on the need, the output is a design. When the focus is on solution, the output is a requirement.
options.D: When the focus is on the need, the output is a requirement. When the focus is on the solution, the output is a design.

question: A business analyst is quantifying the potential benefits of a solution option with key stakeholders. What technique is the BA using?
A business analyst has been assigned to a project that has many key stakeholders. Which technique would help the BA build rapport quickly with the stakeholders?
Which of the following statements is true regarding prioritization?

options.A: Stakeholders may intentionally indicate priority to influence the result to their desired outcome.
options.B: Prioritization is an assessment of absolute value.
options.C: Stakeholders are sometimes rigid, and priorities are unlikely to shift as the context evolves and as more information becomes available.
options.D: Prioritization is based upon the cost of the requirement.

question: Conflicts may arise among stakeholders as a result of different interpretations of requirements or designs. Which technique would you use to resolve issues and gain agreement?

A business analyst wants to use a requirements elicitation technique to produce a broad set of options for an identified problem. Which of the following requirement elicitation activities would be the best approach to satisfy these requirements?
Skipped
A business analyst new to an organization wants to understand roles, responsibilities, and reporting structures in the current state. Which technique would help achieve this goal?
What is the primary purpose of requirements life cycle management?

options.A: To ensure that business, stakeholder, and solution requirements and designs are aligned to one another and that the solution implements them.
options.B: To assemble and communicate business analysis information to stakeholders.
options.C: To assess requirements changes through performing an impact analysis.
options.D: To trace requirements through their life cycle.

question: A business analyst is communicating business analysis information to resource managers via email every Monday as per the stakeholder engagement approach. Those same resource managers contact the BA every week about information that was already emailed. What should the business analyst do to resolve this breakdown in communication?

options.A: Refer the resource managers to the email.
options.B: Engage the source managers to understand if email is an effective mode of communication.
options.C: Replace the emails with weekly meetings and minutes that can be referenced after the meeting.
options.D: Begin scheduling weekly conference calls to provide a forum for follow-up discussion.

question: Which technique would help a business analyst identify the source of relevant business rules for their initiative?
A business analyst is working with a team of stakeholders to assess the feasibility of alternative solutions after calculating their return-on-investment. What is this team most like doing?

options.B: Identifying non-financial benefits of the brainstormed solutions.

question: How would a business analyst apply the core concept of "value" when executing tasks in elicitation and collaboration?

options.A: By understanding stakeholder preferences and what is valuable to them.
options.B: By determining what is relevant to stakeholders and what is not.
options.C: By prioritizing the information elicited from stakeholders.
options.D: By collaborating with stakeholders to assess, confirm, and communicate the relative value of information.

question: Which technique is leveraged to visually show the future state process?
Which of the following underlying competencies will help you understand how the people, processes, and technology within an organization interact?
In which artifact would the proposed approaches to address issues be found?
What is the purpose of assessing requirement changes?

options.B: To analyze root cause of a problem.
options.C: To evaluate the implication of proposed changes to requirements and designs
options.D: To know how many requirements have been documented.

question: As a business analyst, you have been effective in reducing resistance to necessary changes. As such, which underlying competency have you most demonstrated?
A business analyst is using paraphrasing as a means of confirming elicitation results. How can paraphrasing be achieved?

options.A: Asking the sender to resend the message but using different terms
options.C: Use of a different communication medium
options.D: Repetition of exactly what was said

question: Which of the following techniques will help a business analyst understand an organization's current processes when available documents are outdated and most personnel don't speak the BA's language?
Identify the characteristic of a quality requirement that is least satisfied in this requirement: "The call center operator shall be able to view details of a customer."
A business analyst wants to model the "why" of a change. Which technique would be used to accomplish this task?
What is the focus of a "design"?

options.B: Design focuses on the understanding of how value might be realized by a solution if it is built.
options.D: Design focuses on the business need.

question: Business analysts may choose to perform this task themselves and then separately package and communicate the requirements to the impacted/impacting people for review. Which task is being described?
